definition: Vincent Van Gogh (1853-1890), Dutch post-Impressionist painter
abbr. for 梵教[Fan4 jiao4] Brahmanism/abbr. for Sanskrit 梵語|梵语[Fan4 yu3] or 梵文[Fan4 wen2]/abbr. for 梵蒂岡|梵蒂冈[Fan4 di4 gang1], the Vatican

sentences.english: A re-creation of Van Gogh’s Sunflower painting made entirely from sushi.
sentences.chinese: 完全用壽司做的梵高向日葵的複製品。

sentences.english: Regardless, Van Gogh's paintings of sunflowers have altered mankind's perspective of art and life.
sentences.chinese: 梵高的向日葵通過藝術改變了人們對生活的看法。

sentences.english: All Van Gogh's pictures from this time became biographical notes loaded with meaning.
sentences.chinese: 梵高在這段時期的作品都是飽含寓意的自傳式筆記。

sentences.english: "Sunflowers, " by Van Gogh, a painting from the same series as one of the stolen artworks, appears in this photo.
sentences.chinese: 上圖中梵高的名作《向日葵》系被盜畫作之一。

sentences.english: VINCENT VAN GOGH seemed made for a bittersweet Hollywood biopic.
sentences.chinese: 文森梵高的一生就像一部悲喜交加的好萊塢人物傳。

sentences.english: Van Gogh was convinced that the strong yellow sun would fully awaken his palette.
sentences.chinese: 梵高堅信強烈鮮黃的陽光能豐富他創作的色彩。

sentences.english: Van Gogh was undoubtedly influenced by the Impressionism that swept the city's art world.
sentences.chinese: 梵高顯然深受當時襲捲巴黎藝壇的印象派畫風影響。

sentences.english: In Arles, Van Gogh found the perfect premises for this studio of the south.
sentences.chinese: 梵高在亞爾找到設立南方畫室的理想地點。

sentences.english: Van Gogh picked some up from the gutter, and began to paint his first four Sunflower studies.
sentences.chinese: 梵高採了些向日葵回家，畫了最早的四幅向日葵習作。

sentences.english: Gauguin's style in art was like nothing Van Gogh had ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 高更的藝術風格是梵高前所未見的。

sentences.english: Today, you could buy the same "Van Gogh" in Chinatown for the price of a frame.
sentences.chinese: 今天，你可以在唐人街買到與真跡相同的“梵高”。

sentences.english: Digitally changed Van Gogh, Paris, France.
sentences.chinese: 數碼梵高星空圖，巴黎，法國。

sentences.english: Because, of course, everybody knows he couldn't sell his work.
sentences.chinese: 因爲大家都知道梵高在世時作品乏人問津。

sentences.english: The curators insisted that it was a Van Gogh masterpiece valued at $22 million.
sentences.chinese: 策展人堅信這幅是梵高的真跡，價值2200萬美元。

sentences.english: Think about van Gogh, who inspired me a lot when I was younger.
sentences.chinese: 想想梵高，他在我小的時候就給我很多啓迪。

definition: Vincent Van Gogh (1853-1890), Dutch post-Impressionist painter
Vincent Van Gogh (1853-1890), Dutch post-Impressionist painter (Tw)
Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), Italian Renaissance painter
Michelangelo Buonarroti (1475-1564), Renaissance painter and sculptor
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1
